lightracer

Class Racer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lightracer.Racer

  • public class Racer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Racer class represents the two objects that are controlled by the players on the game board. It also sends light trail objects to the game board when the racers move.
    Author:
    Aidan Petit

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Racer(int racerID, int xPosition, int yPosition, int direction) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addLightTrail()
      Creates a light trail object at the racer's current position.
      int getDirection()
      Returns the current direction that the racer is facing.
      int getPlayer()
      Returns if this racer is player 1 or player 2
      int getXPosition()
      Returns the x-coordinate of the racer on the game board.
      int getYPosition()
      Returns the y-coordinate of the racer on the game board.
      boolean hasCrashed()
      Returns whether the racer has collided with another object or not.
      void setDirection(int direction)
      Updates the racer to face the direction of the parameter.
      void setHasCrashed(boolean hasCrashed)
      Tells the racer that it has collided with another object
      void setXPosition(int xPosition)
      Adjusts the x-coordinate of the racer on the game board.
      void setYPosition(int yPosition)
      Adjusts the y-coordinate of the racer on the game board.

    • Method Detail

      • addLightTrail

        public void addLightTrail()
        Creates a light trail object at the racer's current position.

      • hasCrashed

        public boolean hasCrashed()
        Returns whether the racer has collided with another object or not.
        Returns:
        true The racer has collided with another object

        false The racer has not collided with another object

      • setHasCrashed

        public void setHasCrashed(boolean hasCrashed)
        Tells the racer that it has collided with another object
        Parameters:
        hasCrashed - Legacy implementation. Value does not matter.

      • getPlayer

        public int getPlayer()
        Returns if this racer is player 1 or player 2
        Returns:
        1 This is player 1's racer

        2 This is player 2's racer

      • getXPosition

        public int getXPosition()
        Returns the x-coordinate of the racer on the game board.
        Returns:
        The current x-position of the racer

      • setXPosition

        public void setXPosition(int xPosition)
        Adjusts the x-coordinate of the racer on the game board.
        Parameters:
        xPosition - The new x-position of the racer

      • getYPosition

        public int getYPosition()
        Returns the y-coordinate of the racer on the game board.
        Returns:
        The current y-position of the racer

      • setYPosition

        public void setYPosition(int yPosition)
        Adjusts the y-coordinate of the racer on the game board.
        Parameters:
        yPosition - The new y-position of the racer

      • getDirection

        public int getDirection()
        Returns the current direction that the racer is facing.
        Returns:
        0 The racer is facing up

        1 The racer is facing right

        2 The racer is facing down

        3 The racer is facing left

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(int direction)
        Updates the racer to face the direction of the parameter.
        Parameters:
        direction - The new direction of the racer
